review_text:
Julie's place was one of our favorite stays ever! We love hiking and National Parks, so we were completely delighted with the home's theme (wall art of her and David's travels to National Parks). Additionally, the handmade wood furniture and locally crafted pottery made GOE a special place that we want to visit again.
Parents of littles will want to know:
-Julie put nightlights in every room!
-Yes, there are many breakable things, but also a great closet where you can stash them (with sliding door that my toddler couldn't open). We put their guitar away the moment we got there, but if you're a musical family, you'll love having the instruments!
-house has washer/dryer AND detergent; bathrooms have shampoo/conditioner/body wash
-bathrooms have great medicine cabinets if you need to keep things out of reach of kids (or just like a clear vanity space on vacation!)
-bring your own plastic plates/sippy cups if you need those
-As a family of 4, we didn't need the extra room that is optional
-You are within walking distance of one Union City Kiwanis park and a 5-minute drive from Graham park (where our boys got out all sorts of energy!). We LOVED hiking at Reelfoot Lake and exploring and seeing eagles at the National Wildlife Refuge there (30-minutes away) and our boys (7 and 3) loved Discovery Park of America (5 minutes away). Our Pink Palace membership in Memphis got us into Discovery Park for free (so ask if you have memberships in other cities that might have reciprocity).
-Plenty of convenient take-out in the town.
We packed a lot into a 4-day trip. I think we'll stay longer next time!
